results.title: Genetic biology
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines two qualities that are essential to the existence of species: the genetic mechanisms that preserve continuity from one generation to the next and the mechanisms that ensure variation. Also explores the recent breakthroughs of molecular genetics in the area of recombinant DNA which have led to biological applications with strong social implications.

results.title: Behavioural biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Looks at behaviour patterns and their relationship to brain and nerve cell circuits. Shows that behaviour can be both inherited and adaptive by examining simple forms of behaviour in single celled organisms. Also presents an inquiry that culminates in an open-ended analysis of some aspects of human behaviour.

results.title: International Monetary System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An historically detailed understanding of the international monetary system. Covers the Bretton Woods system with its features; role of the US dollar, International Monetary Fund, performance, problems and final collapse. Follows on after Bretton Woods system with the managed float era, pressure and problems, issues and possible reforms to the international monetary system.

results.title: Stock exchange & takeovers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC economic series) A comprehensive introduction to the stock exchange and takeovers. Covers the reason for having a stock exchange and how it works; buying and selling; how the public is informed; defines takeovers and their motivation; explains how are they made and if they are good or bad for the economy. No other credits available.

results.title: Prices & incomes policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC economics series). Interviews with Andrew Hay (Confederation of Employers), Simon Crean (ACTU), John Halfpenny (Australian Metalworkers Union) and Kerry Klineberg (Chamber of Manufactures) on Australian prices and incomes policy. Covers aims; perception by the community; development 1903-1983; the Accord and its achievements until 1983 and perceptions of the current situation.

results.title: The Role of government in the Australian economy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck examines the role of the Australian Government in formulating economic policies. Discusses the Australian Public Sector, the market system, market capitalism, the Great Debate and other recent Australian experiences.

results.title: Exam technique: economics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Offers specialised exam preparation advice for economics students. Discusses the weeks prior to the exam, strategies for the night before, format and use of time in the exam itself, multiple choice and short answer questions and essay choice and planning.

results.title: Inflation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
A review of inflation covering a definition of terms, general and specific causes and measurement. Understanding this topic is a basic requirement for further study in the area of unemployment and prices policy.

results.title: Economic growth. 2. Policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, dicusses economic growth in Australia, causes of Australian growth and implication for Government policies.
